result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus L Wakeley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marcus L Wakeley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marcus L Wakeley was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus L Wakeley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Marcus L Wakeley
Current: N6425 River Rd, Princeton, WI 54968 United States  (Effective: 08-03-2015)
Prior: 403 Van Horn Rd, Berlin, WI 54923
Judgment of Conviction has been returned.  Return to sender.  Re-sent to:  N6425 River Rd  Princeton, WI  54968

9:53 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 with a fine and costs and will dismiss count 2.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as domestic.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed outright.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  

$250 fine plus court costs and $100 domestic abuse assessment.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 9:58 a.m.

9:50 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - will not be getting an attorney and will represent himself.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Court sets for Status Hearing on July 21, 2015 at 9:30 a.m.  Defendant to make an appointment with the DA's office.

Court adjourned at 9:51 a.m.

1:03 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present by video without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest.  Court enters not guilty plea on both counts.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Violent Contact with Amanda O.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court will set for Status Hearing on July 7, 2015 at 9:30 a.m..

Court adjourned at 1:07 p.m.
